required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Selective Effect of Foam Rolling and Manual Massage
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Self-myofascial Release and Manual Massage on Psychometric, Behavioural and Neurophysiological Indexes of Performance and Well-being: a Randomized Control Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Laboratoire Interuniversitaire de Biologie de la Motricité

clinical_study.source: Laboratoire Interuniversitaire de Biologie de la Motricité

brief_summary.textblock: The present double-blinded randomized controlled design aims at comparing the effects of a full-body manual massage and foam rolling intervention. Sixty-five healthy individuals were randomly allocated to foam rolling, manual massage or a control intervention consisting in an autogenic relaxation routine.

detailed_description.textblock: Self-report ratings of perceived anxiety, muscle pain and relaxation were the psychometric outcome variables. Sit-and-reach, toes-touch and mental calculation performances were the behavioral variables. Resting-state alpha and beta power recorded using electroencephalography and galvanic skin resistance measures were the neurophysiological outcome variables.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Three independent groups, two measurement points

primary_outcome.measure: Change in range of motion measures from standardized flexibility tests
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pretest and an immediate posttest after the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Lower back and hamstring flexibility index from sit-and-reach and toe touch tests

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pretest and an immediate posttest after the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Power of alpha and beta neural oscillations

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in subjective scores (self-reports on numeric rating scales)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pretest and an immediate posttest after the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Perceived anxiety and physical sensations (muscle pain, warmth and relaxation) on a numeric rating scale of 10 cm (0: "Complete absence of anxiety/muscle pain/muscle warmth/muscle relaxation"; 10: "Maximal possible levels of anxiety/muscle pain/muscle warmth/muscle relaxation")

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pretest and an immediate posttest after the intervention
Pretest and an immediate posttest after the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Skin conductance during resting state periods

arm_group.description: The foam rolling routine consisted in unilateral exercises alternatively performed on both legs and bilateral exercises on lower and back muscles. All participants started with the feet in a standing up position with a lacrosse ball. Then, participants performed on the ground the foam rolling exercises with the foam roller targeting leg and back muscles.

Participants in the manual massage group received manual massage by a professional physiotherapist who was blinded to the purpose of the experiment (20 years of registered practice). Participants were lying in the prone position on a massage table. To facilitate the physiotherapist's maneuvers, massage oil was used. The manual massage protocol reproduced several features of the foam rolling intervention, i.e., order of the areas massaged, massage time per muscles and total duration of the session.

Participants in the relaxation group listened to a 16 min relaxation audio tape, based on the autogenic training method. Participants were lying on the massage table in supine position, wearing headphones. During this desensitization-relaxation technique, they were guided to visualize bodily perceptions of heaviness and warmth in their arms, thorax and legs. To facilitate concentration, participants were left alone in a dark room.

intervention.description: Self-report of perceived anxiety and physical sensations (muscle pain, relaxation and warmth)
Alpha and beta oscillation power (4 minutes recordings)
Skin conductance during the resting state period

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Regular practice of foam rolling (10 min routines, 2-3 times per week over the past 6 months)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Chronic medical conditions including functional limitations that might affect proprioception and/or pain perception

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Laboratoire Interuniversitaire de Biologie de la Motricité
